snippet: The Supreme Court should reaffirm the longstanding practice of recess appointments that keeps government functioning.
abstract: Editorial contends what is at stake in the case before the Supreme Court regarding recess appointments by the president is that the government must be able to function even when Congress cannot or will not do its job; urges the court to reaffirm the longstanding practice of recess appointments, which is consistent with both the language and the meaning of the Constitution.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court should reaffirm the longstanding practice of recess appointments that keeps government functioning.
